ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I developed the skill of thinking in Spanish rather than English and translating out loud. I also learned plenty about Hispanic culture and history.
I really learned how to critically think in Spanish, as well as what tools I work with best when it comes to learning Spanish.
In this course I was able to develop my conversational skills in Spanish.
I got more comfortable with my speaking, reading and writing skills in Spanish.
I learned to think more deeply when I analyzed literary works.
I improved my spanish vocabulary, grammar, speaking, and writing abilities. I also gained more comfort with the language.

This course covers much of what previous Spanish class curriculums covered surrounding vocabulary and grammatical topics. The concepts were understandable and my knowledge was most definitely enriched. I also left the class with a better understanding of cultural topics regarding Spanish speaking countries.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This class was very collaborative and taught in a way where I enjoyed all the work we did, and it all felt very useful to my learning. Professor Baffi is also an incredible instructor.
This course met everyday so I had constant conversational engagement, but because it met everyday, I would always have a lot of Spanish work to complete each day.
The small seminar-style of the course was very conducive to practicing the language with others. I also thought the asynchronous day was helpful for studying on my own.
I did not think this class had any weaknesses. It was taught extremely well. I thought the asynchronous element was a a great way to check in with myself about how well I understood the material.

This course does a good job of providing students with a lot of opportunities to practice their Spanish. It would be helpful to get more timely feedback on the assignments, however, so students can use that feedback to improve their next assignments.
This course offered me access and the ability to practice language everyday. The work though was very manageable and did not take an extreme amount of time to complete.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes I would for any student interested in improving their Spanish proficiency; without a doubt this will challenge them and they will have had some sort of improvement at the end of the year.
I would (and have!) recommend this course to other students, just because it was such a great way for me to become comfortable with Spanish again.

I would recommend this course to another student. The work environment was focused on building conversational skills and writing skills. Meeting for class everyday encouraged constant engagement in the language.
Yes! I learned a lot and Professor Baffi was wonderful.
Yes. It was extremely engaging, and I feel more confident in my ability to speak the language.
Yes, for students interesting in learning spanish.

YES, Profe Baffi is an incredible teacher and is always there for students. She gives them the space to practice their Spanish and does not critique every little thing. Rather, she creates an environment that commends growth and development in each student rather than a set bar of expectations. I can say that I looked forward to coming to class everyday because of the environment Baffi created.
